result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew Albert Popp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Mathew Albert Popp.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense request final pre-trial and jury trial dates. All documents need to be filed by the final pre-trial date. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christin Saint Pierre appeared by video means.   
Case in court for status conference. State provides offer on the record. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel appeared by video means.
Case in court for status. Defense in receipt of discovery but needs an offer and requests an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Br 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the Court, case is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel appeared by video means.
Case in court for status. Defense in need of discovery and offer, requests an adjournment. Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mathew Albert Popp appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Christin St. Pierre who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $25.00/month beginning on 8/1/2022 and on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.R. and X.Z.L.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Mathew Albert Popp in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant REFUSED Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 2p
